definition: to create difficulties/to invite trouble/to be troublesome
to provoke/to irritate/to vex/to stir up/to anger/to attract (troubles)/to cause (problems)
variant of 麻[ma2]/hemp
generic name for hemp, flax etc/hemp or flax fiber for textile materials/sesame/CL:縷|缕[lu:3]/(of materials) rough or coarse/pocked/pitted/to have pins and needles or tingling/to feel numb
surname Ma
to feel vexed/to bother/to trouble/superfluous and confusing/edgy

sentences.english: much to worry about; they always make trouble for you.
sentences.chinese: 事要操心，还老是惹麻烦给你。

sentences.english: If you turn a deaf ear to my warnings, you'll land in trouble.
sentences.chinese: 如果你对我的告诫充耳不闻，你就会惹麻烦的。

sentences.english: Once upon a time, parents worried about their kids being out late at night getting into trouble.
sentences.chinese: 曾几何时，家长总是担心孩子们夜不归宿惹麻烦。

sentences.english: Civil disobedience will only further the public perception that black people like to cause trouble.
sentences.chinese: 非暴力抗议只会让公众关于黑人爱惹麻烦的印象更深。

sentences.english: Joe often gets into fights because he is always looking for bother.
sentences.chinese: 乔常跟人家打架，因为他总是惹麻烦。

sentences.english: The boy is very active, ha never flays up.
sentences.chinese: 这个男孩很活跃，但从来不惹麻烦。

sentences.english: "Ask for to bother?"The summer rather inquires brocade heart.
If you lock up your anger it will only cause trouble later.
sentences.chinese: 你要是把怒气压着不发泄出来，那以后就会惹麻烦的。

sentences.english: You can't get in trouble for wrecking the unsalvageable!
sentences.chinese: 你不会因破坏不可修复的东西惹麻烦。

sentences.english: Oh, my brother has broken his leg. He is always making troubles.
sentences.chinese: 哦，我弟弟摔断了腿，他总是惹麻烦。

sentences.english: "Listen, " said the shoplifter, "I know you don't want any trouble either.
sentences.chinese: “听着，”小偷说，“我知道你们也不想惹麻烦。

sentences.english: My heart is what keeps getting me in trouble.
sentences.chinese: 我就是太随性才会惹麻烦的。

sentences.english: One of her students was called Eklund and he was handful. He often got in trouble.
sentences.chinese: 有个叫埃克伦的学生很难管，经常惹麻烦。

sentences.english: Don't waste time complaining about it; you'll just get into a lot of trouble.
sentences.chinese: 你别浪费时间去提意见了，你会给自己惹麻烦的。

sentences.english: He makes trouble and dances like a star.
sentences.chinese: 他老是惹麻烦，还像明星一样跳舞。

definition: to cause trouble
to look for trouble
to stir up trouble
to cause trouble for sb/to inconvenience
variant of 惹是生非[re3 shi4 sheng1 fei1]
(coll.) to cause trouble for sb/to inconvenience
to stir up trouble/to invite disaster
to stir up trouble/to get into trouble
to disturb/to look for trouble/to stir up a row/to bother sb intentionally
to stir up trouble
to cause an accident/to make trouble/to get into trouble
to ask for trouble/to invite difficulties
to provoke/to tease
a new branch grows out of a knot (idiom); fig. side issues keep arising
meddling in other people's business
to look for employment/to pick a quarrel
